question.text: Which of these statements is correct about the five kingdoms given by Whittaker?

options.text: Most of the kingdoms have organisms with a poorly defined nucleus.
Most of the kingdoms have organisms with a cell wall.
Most of the kingdoms have organisms with only one cell.
Most of the kingdoms have organisms with RNA as the genetic material.

solution.text: Kingdoms Protista, Plantae, Fungi and Animalia have a well-defined nucleus. Only Kingdom Monera has a poorly defined nucleus. Kingdoms Plantae, Fungi, and Animalia are multicellular. All members of Kingdoms Monera, Protista, Plantae, Fungi, and Animalia have DNA as the genetic material. Kingdoms Monera, Plantae, Fungi have a well defined cell wall.
